meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: 'Spring' and 'Coast' Star at Tony Awards ''Spring Awakening,'' above, dominated the Tony Awards for musicals last night, winning in eight categories. Below, the playwright Tom Stoppard, left, whose ''Coast of Utopia'' was the big winner among the plays, and Frank Langella, named best actor in a play for ''Frost/Nixon.''

A Shift on Immigration Bill Senate Democrats opened the door to reviving the stalled immigration measure, calling on Republicans to resolve their divisions and produce an agreement on how to move the legislation forward.
Lauder to Head Jewish Group Ronald S. Lauder, the cosmetics magnate, was elected president of the World Jewish Congress, the nonprofit group that fought to win billions for Holocaust victims.
Two Studied Dow Jones Bid NBC and Microsoft considered making a bid for Dow Jones, the publisher of The Wall Street Journal, but decided against it, a source close to the two companies said.
Spurs Look Strong Again The San Antonio Spurs took a 2-0 lead in the N.B.A. finals with an 103-92 victory against the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Richard Rorty Dies The philosopher whose inventive work made him one of the world's most influential contemporary thinkers was 75.
Business of Health Improving the efficiency of the health care system may be good for society, but there's a debate over who should pay for it.

'Spring' and 'Coast' Star at Tony Awards ''Spring Awakening,'' above, dominated the Tony Awards for musicals last night, winning in eight categories. Below, the playwright Tom Stoppard, left, whose ''Coast of Utopia'' was the big winner among the plays, and Frank Langella, named best actor in a play for ''Frost/Nixon.''

A Shift on Immigration Bill Senate Democrats opened the door to reviving the stalled immigration measure, calling on Republicans to resolve their divisions and produce an agreement on how to move the legislation forward.
Lauder to Head Jewish Group Ronald S. Lauder, the cosmetics magnate, was elected president of the World Jewish Congress, the nonprofit group that fought to win billions for Holocaust victims.
Two Studied Dow Jones Bid NBC and Microsoft considered making a bid for Dow Jones, the publisher of The Wall Street Journal, but decided against it, a source close to the two companies said.
Spurs Look Strong Again The San Antonio Spurs took a 2-0 lead in the N.B.A. finals with an 103-92 victory against the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Richard Rorty Dies The philosopher whose inventive work made him one of the world's most influential contemporary thinkers was 75.
Business of Health Improving the efficiency of the health care system may be good for society, but there's a debate over who should pay for it.
